text.tspan: In Brazil, the Ministry of Health requested the support of the Brazilian Red Cross
(CVB) to implement the national immunisation plan, as the lead partner of the
government vaccination roll out across all states. The CVB established mobile
vaccination units and distributed PPE equipment in those centres, as well as in
senior citizen homes.
The research helped the national society with their "vaccine bus" project that
has allowed the population to access vaccines in places with little
infrastructure. CVB addressed how vaccination was important to prevent the
loss of loved ones, for example, one of the fears most highlighted by the people
interviewed.
They have also prioritised the issue of food cards, because during the interviews
conducted for the survey, volunteers identified that many people, especially the
low-income public, were having difficulty getting help from the government to
meet their food needs.
The survey shed a lot of light for the national society on the levels of trust in
actors and the ways in which people have been informed about the pandemic.
The CVB has been using social media more to disseminate information and
debunk “fake news”, a well-documented challenge in Brazil.
BRAZIL
Photo by Brazilian Red Cross
